We’re happy to show you our new merch design!
Our museum in St. Petersburg created these t-shirts together with a local illustrator bureau. And last week we made a photoshoot of the museum’s team wearing new merch 🤩
BTW, shirts are already on sale — but temporarily only in SPb https://t.co/Hu6wDf6sCb

We have a special plate in our museum in Moscow.
It’s placed in the reception area and has all the information on the condition of our machines at the moment. They’re fragile and break quite often.
Here you can see which ones work and which are in repairs — we renew it every day! https://t.co/vgZvr0y0LE

Hi everyone! We wanted to announce a new syrup flavor we got for our Soviet soda water machine — Lemon Syrup🍋 
Although it’s new in our menu, Lemon flavor is made according to Soviet GOSTs as all our other syrups. So it’s 💯% authentic!
Come and taste it in our Museum in Moscow! https://t.co/NWigmewiOg

We have great news! There’s a new arrival in our museum in Moscow. It’s a Soviet vending machine that used to spray cologne! Though it doesn’t work now, we’ll try to improve it👍
It’s very pretty and rare, and it’s also the oldest machine in our exposition — it was made in 1960s! https://t.co/8Lf9woqQYs

Here is the machine we have in our museum in Moscow. It’s the only copy we have and it’s super rare. Ladies & gentlemen, we’re pleased to introduce “Lobis” - one and only gambling machine that we have. Unfortunately, it’s in repair mode now, but it doesn’t make it less exciting! https://t.co/o84MJRnynx

Hi! Here’s a super cool table game — “From morning to night”. It’s based on a “regular” day of a St. Petersburg citizen: visiting Hermitage museum,  dancing salsa between the Rostral Columns, eating shawarma for lunch and even driving to Finland (oh yes, we all live like that 😎) https://t.co/6Tzotl1f6C

Hi everyone! We’re back to tell you about one of the coolest new things we have in our museum in Moscow. It’s a vending machine that makes oxygen cocktails! And now we’ve repaired it so every guest can take a sip of this tasty and super healthy drink 🥳
Have you ever tried it? https://t.co/YUeTSHo0io

In 1960’s, when vending machines just began to appear in USSR, “Progress” store was opened in Malaya Dmitrovka St. in Moscow. And it was REALLY progressive: there were no salesmen, all  sales were fully automated! These machines sold different dairy products: milk, butter, etc 🥛 https://t.co/Oz8yxcKzSn
